intro: Leucanthemum chamaemelum, commonly known as the common tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are deeply lobed and yellow flowers with white ray florets surrounding yellow disk florets. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. Due to its toxicity, it is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
